article.title: Bayesian random-effects meta-analysis using the bayesmeta R package

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 2: Forest Plot\n\n**Question:** What does the grey bar next to each study estimate represent?
choices: 95% confidence interval of the study effect
95% credible interval of the study effect
Shrinkage interval of the study-specific effect
Prediction interval for a future study effect

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 3: Posterior Plots\n\n**Question:** In the top right plot, what does the blue line with surrounding lighter blue shading represent?
choices: Marginal posterior distribution of the effect
Predictive distribution for a future study effect
Conditional posterior mean effect as a function of heterogeneity with 95% interval
Marginal posterior density of the heterogeneity

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 4: Density Plots\n\n**Question:** What does the green dashed line in the right panel represent?
choices: Posterior predictive density of the study-specific effect
Prior density of the study-specific effect
Initial estimate of the study effect based on its standard error
Shrinkage estimate of the study-specific effect

multiple_choice_question.text: Figure 5: Prior Predictive CDFs\n\n**Question:** What information does this figure convey about the different heterogeneity priors?
choices: The prior probability of observing a beneficial effect in each study.
The expected variability in true study means under different prior assumptions.
The impact of different priors on the estimated overall effect.
The relative weight assigned to each study by different priors.
